TEXT: The applicant , Mr PERSON , is a NORP citizen who was born in DATE and lives in GPE , GPE and GPE . The respondent Government are represented by their Agent , PERSON .
The facts of the case , as submitted by the parties , may be summarised as follows .
On DATE the applicant brought a civil action for damages with the ORG ( PERSON ) , against the GPE , PERSON and the insurance company C.
On DATE the applicant ’s son entered the proceedings as the second plaintiff .

Before the period to be examined by ORG entered into force in respect of GPE on DATE ) ORG ( PERSON ) transferred the case to ORG ( PERSON ) , at the applicant ’s request . The first instance court adjourned CARDINAL hearings due to the applicant ’s absence and held CARDINAL hearing . On several occasions the applicant asked the court to stay the proceedings because the criminal proceedings against GPE , relevant for the case in question , were still pending .

On DATE the first instance court asked ORG ( PERSON ORG ) about the state of the criminal proceedings against FAC On DATE ORG informed ORG that the proceedings in question had been terminated because the statutory limitation had expired .
On DATE ORG requested the criminal case file against FAC from ORG . On DATE the case file was submitted .
On CARDINAL and CARDINAL DATE ORG asked CARDINAL different ORG Offices for information about the criminal case file against GPE
On DATE ORG ( Općinsko državno odvjetništvo u PERSON ) informed the court that all proceedings against PERSON had been terminated due to the expiration of the statutory limitation .
At the next hearing before ORG on DATE the court stayed the proceedings ( mirovanje postupka ) because the applicant did not appear .
On DATE the applicant and his son asked the court to be exempted from the payment of the costs of the proceedings .
On DATE the applicant ’s son filed an appeal against the decision to stay the proceedings .
On DATE ORG held a hearing and exempted the applicant and his son from paying the costs of the proceedings . The case file was forwarded to the appellate court upon the appeal of DATE .
On DATE the appellate court rejected the appeal as being lodged by an unauthorised person .
On DATE the applicant asked the first instance court to proceed with his case .
On DATE the court asked the applicant to clarify his claim and submit relevant medical and other documentation .
On DATE the applicant filed additional submissions .
On DATE the court dismissed the applicant ’s claim as incomprehensible and because the applicant had failed to submit the relevant documents .
On DATE the applicant and his son respectively appealed against the above decision .
On DATE ORG ( PERSON u GPE ) rejected both appeals .
Both the applicant and his son filed a request for revision with ORG on DATE respectively .
On DATE ORG granted the request and quashed the first and appellate decisions and remitted the case for a re - trial to ORG .
It appears that the proceedings are presently pending before the court of first instance .

The relevant parts of LAW of LAW on LAW ( entered into force on DATE , published in ORG no . CARDINAL of CARDINAL May CARDINAL - hereinafter “ LAW on the LAW ” - Ustavni zakon o Ustavnom sudu PERSON ) read as follows :

( CARDINAL ) The Constitutional Court shall examine a constitutional complaint even before all legal remedies have been exhausted in cases when a competent court has not decided within a reasonable time a claim concerning the applicant ’s rights and obligations or a criminal charge against him ...

( CARDINAL ) If the constitutional complaint ... under paragraph CARDINAL of this Section is accepted , the ORG shall determine a time - limit within which a competent court shall decide the case on the merits ...

( CARDINAL ) In a decision under paragraph CARDINAL of this LAW , the Constitutional Court shall fix appropriate compensation for the applicant in respect of the violation found concerning his constitutional rights ... The compensation shall be paid from the ORG budget within a term of DATE from the date when the party lodged a request for its payment .
